Half Life 2, in my opinion, is possibly the best in the franchise. It utilizes several puzzles to make the player think instead of just shoot. But it also allows the player to have fun with it's sandbox and just restrict to certain areas of a level and instead use the physics to solve a puzzle. It also has an amazing story with compelling characters and makes the player really think about what's happening around. Along with story telling through dialogue, environments, and combat, the player can also interact with npc's and learn about the world from a civilian in City 17's point of view. 10/10 would recommend.

即使来到了2021年，这款将近16年前的FPS游戏依旧让我觉得很惊艳。剧情氛围渲染得特别好，玩起来很很紧张刺激。我一连玩了3个小时，发现自己出现了3D眩晕的症状。除了玩赛车模拟器，这是第一次晕3D，据说是因为这个游戏做得太真实了。总而言之好评。把半条命2打完之后，我就去玩Alyx了！

Why am I writing a review for Half-Life 2 in the year of 2021? Because it's genuinely phenomenal, that's why. 

Seriously, this game consistently introduces new and fun mechanics throughout the sub 20 hour run-time of this campaign. The physics of the Source engine is still one of the best in the business. There are some decently simplistic physics based puzzles that not only test the player but also show off the engine. The graphics are honestly still very good looking considering the year it came out; it hasn't aged much at all even compared to graphical tech giants like HL: Alyx to keep it series related. Every area has its own atmosphere and overall (for lack of a better word) gimmick which plays into it the entire way through. The story is fun and the character writing is top-class. The existentialism of the ever alluring magnificence of the G Man makes this story coupled with the characters, timeless.

I wanted to play Half-Life as a series for a long time and finally I decided to fork the measly 10 bucks for the entire series on sale and now I finally understand why everyone treats the concept of Half-Life 3 as the next coming of gaming Jesus. Time to start Episode 1 and 2, I hope they can deliver even a quarter of what this did.

Good Game, for the first few hours. after the buggy/ATV level, the game starts to get very stale and repetitive very quickly - highlighted by the fact that almost HALF of the players quit playing at or before this level. I originally purchased this game (and the other episodes) so that I could get the backstory for Half Life: Alyx, but frankly the mindless drag through this game makes me wish that I had not. I will be claiming a refund on the episodes, but sadly the time has passed for the refund period on this game.

I don't say the game is bad, I just didn't like it. Big world with not much in it. It's full of character and it's really unique, but its dated and feels barren. I think this is one of the games many say is perfect because of the nostalgia glasses, I've never played Half Life before and I can't say "it was my first game" or "i grew up with this" type of stuff. IMHO this is the type of game you could kinda enjoy if you didnt have anything else better to do.
